replies.author: dugenkui03

replies.bodyText:
You are worried about performance but you have provided no evidence its an actual performance problem
The number of directives on an element is most likely 0 and less than 5 in most cases.
Same with field arguments - there are just not enough of them to be a problem
Now if we can show that these methods turn up in some "runtime hotspot" during execution then it starts to make more sense
Also the JVM is EXCELLENT at escape analysis - if it can determine that a variable NEVER escapes the frame then it will allocate objects on the stack and they will be cleaned up at near zero cost.
return directivesByName(directives).get(name); is such a case - this map created can be detected as NEVER escaping this method and will be allocated on the stack
